name: party-donations
description: German political parties have received over 200 million euros in donations over the last four years, but only 13 million was immediately reported. How firms systematically hide party donations.

name: EU-migration-policy
description: From tackling the root causes of migration to fighting human trafficking: The EU has many different goals for its migration policy. On paper they are sold as equal. Financially, they are not.

name: migration-and-development-aid
description: Is it possible to stop people from migrating by increasing financial aid to developing countries? This may be effective in some cases. But aid money alone cannot stop major migration waves.

name: quantify-europe_income-thresholds
description: What's your class?

name: quantify-europe_housing
description: How does the housing situation in Germany differ from other European countries?

name: quantify-europe_asylum-seekers
description: What's the extent of the refugee crisis in Europe?

name: quantify-europe_unemployment
description: How has unemployment evolved since Europe's economic crisis?

name: quantify-europe_voter-turnout
description: How has voter turnout in Europe evolved?

name: Oscars-gender-ratio
description: What's the gender ratio of 2018 Oscars nominees?

name: SDG-data-availability
description: How is the data availability to measure progress of Sustainable development goals?

name: Visa-applications-Africa-Asia
description: It's not easy for Africans to obtain a visa to visit Germany. A DW data analysis reveals that one in five applications is rejected, far more than for other parts of the world.

name: wm2018
description: How to national football leagues compare? Is the German Bundesliga better than the British Premier League?

name: greek-economy
description: Greece will exit its stability program on Monday. How has the Greek economy developed since austerity was imposed in 2010? And is Greece prepared to meet the budgetary targets? A data analysis provides answers.

name: travel-cost
description: Trains vs. planes: What's the real cost of travel? Flights often seem to be the fastest and cheapest travel options. That's not so, as DW's data visualizations show. Factoring in transit time and environmental damage, here's how to assess the true costs of travel.

name: quantify-europe_plastic-packaging-waste
description: What happens to our plastic packaging waste?

name: EU-lobbying
description: Which non-EU actors lobby the EU?

name: cop24-airquality
description: Script and data for the air quality charts for the COP24 climate change conference.

name: quantify-europe_energy-mix
description: What share of energy consumption relies on renewable sources/fossil fuels/nuclear energy?

name: eu-resettlements
description: The EU has set up various measures to curb unauthorized migration. One of them is offering more legal pathways to the European Union with the help of resettlement pledges. As a data analysis shows, this is not working.

name: climate-risk-insurances
description: The world's poor are being encouraged to take out insurance against climate-related disasters. But as the logic of some schemes unravels, those who profited least from fossil fuels are left paying for their damage.

name: greek-island-refugee-camps
description: The already inhumane conditions in migration hotspots on Greek islands have been worsening for months. Here's what options exist to ameliorate the situation — and why they don't seem to take.

name: minimum-wage
description: Methodology, script and data for the article "Germany's minimum wage is barely above the poverty line"

name: movie-tropes
description: Methodology, data and code behind the DW articles on stereotypes in Hollywood movies and the Oscar-Academy's favorite tropes

name: eu-funding
description: Data, code and methodology behind the piece on EU regional funding

name: european-values
description: Data and code behind the story "What are European Values?"

name: young-voters
description: Where do young voters matter in the European election?

name: euwahl2019
description: European Parliament Election 2019 - Results Analysis

name: European-election-voterturnout
description: Voter Turnout in the European parliament election 2019

name: fwwc2019
description: Data and methodology behind the story "World Cup shows how nations back women's soccer — or don't"

name: mep-sociodemographics
description: Age and gender balance of the 2019 incoming European Parliament

name: discrimination-europe
description: Data, code and methodology behind the story on the rise of xenophobia in Europe

name: war-and-peace
description: Methodology, data and code behind the story on how wars have changed since the end of the cold war

name: border-controls
description: Data, code and methodology behind the story on border controls in the Schengen Area

name: eu-ets
description: Data behind the story on the EU emissions trading system

name: coronavirus
description: Methodology, data and code behind our story on the novel coronavirus in Wuhan in context.

name: coronavirus-africa
description: As the SARS-CoV-2 virus begins to spread in African countries, this data-driven analysis explores the scale of the threat to the continent and the capacity of healthcare systems to respond to it.

name: locusts-outbreak
description: East Africa is still battling its worst locust invasion in decades. Amid the COVID-19 crisis, countries are fighting to stop a new generation of locusts swarms.

name: russian-arms-exports-africa
description: Arms exports are a key component of Russia’s economy. In the last two decades, Moscow has managed to deepen its connection with Africa and became the biggest arms supplier on the continent.

name: covid19-trend
description: While the first countries are easing their lockdowns, others report more and more new cases every day. Data for the global picture shows: the pandemic is far from over.

name: broadband-cities
description: Working from home is the new normal for millions of people worldwide. Yet data shows that six in 10 users don't have internet connections fast enough for smooth teleworking. Has the pandemic deepened the digital divide?

name: internet-shutdowns
description: India shuts down the internet more than any other country. Kashmiris, in the north, had no internet access at all for almost a year. A DW analysis found that shutdowns are strategically used to clamp down on dissent.

name: mobile-internet
description: In Malawi, people have been paying around 87% of gross national income per capita for 1GB of mobile data. Rwandans only pay 2%. DW examines the reasons for this huge price discrepancy.

name: trade-dispute
description: With tariffs on China high, US importers are turning to other countries to source cell phones, computers or furniture.

name: covid19-vaccine-tracker
description: Researchers around the world are trying to develop safe and effective vaccines against SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19. Here's their progress so far.

name: corsia
description: Data and methodology behind our analysis of the CORSIA global aviation emissions scheme

name: image-search
description: Google images search displays sexualized images for women from some regions of the world. Our data analysis shows which regions are most affected.

name: crm
description: The so-called critical raw materials are thirty resources identified by the European Union that are irreplaceable for its future industry. DW analyzed the production, market distortion, future demand, alternative elements, environmental damages and human rights violations during the mining process.

name: gender-olympics
description: In which countries are female Olympic athletes thriving?

name: candidates
description: Analysis of the speeches and voting records of Angela Merkel's potential successors as German chancellor

name: persine
description: Persine is an automated tool to study and reverse-engineer algorithmic recommendation systems.

description: Code, data and methodology behind the investigation into how Europe's prisons are handling the pandemic

name: eutf-africa
description: Taking stock of the EU Emergency Trust Fund for Africa

description: The winners of the Oscars category "best international movie" are mainly European.

description: Under pressure to reach net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, the EU is pushing policies to build wind turbines and solar panels, phase out electric cars and replace gas boilers with heat pumps.
